programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil look back at Susan and John's build that involved growing and extending their household. They were torn over their unique five-bed home in Rushden. Susan loved the house, but John had enough of the disjointed, boxy rooms.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Wolverhampton, it's the turn of IT worker and self-confessed hippy Kyle Ferguson to cook. Kyle has spoken his mind throughout the week but now it's his turn to prove himself in the kitchen, but is he just too laid back to pull off his Wolverhampton inspired menu? Some great entertainment gets Bally and Niru moving, but the big question remains: will smooth Stefano eventually win points with model May?

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples compete to host the best dinner party in Essex, in a week featuring deep-fried jam sandwiches and some attention-grabbing burlesque.

programme.title: Chateau DIY

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Entrepreneur and sports fishing enthusiast Ian Walls from Edinburgh has decided to expand his property portfolio by buying a place on Grand Bahama where he can spend a couple of months every winter.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: After being recently widowed, Jan wants a fresh start. Should she move closer to her much loved sister Chris in Kent, or take the bolder step of buying a wreck in Italy which would provide her with a project to keep her busy? Presenter Laura Hamilton finds some lovely properties to tempt Jan with a relocation in Kent, while Jasmine Harman meets up with the two sisters in Abruzzo.

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole visit Witney in Oxfordshire. Henry comes across a tractor which hasn't run for quite a few years, but it's no problem for restorer Alan, the mechanical medic.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the first day in Swansea and fitness fanatic Jen Edwards is producing a low-carb menu for her guests: school teacher James Knight, rugby hunk Keith Larrard, solicitor Katherine Waldemar Brown and outspoken fussy eater Karen Wood.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The second day of the competition in Swansea sees school teacher James Knight host his dinner party. James is putting on a school-themed occasion, complete with children's party games and a `dress for detention' dress code.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the midway point of the culinary competition in Swansea and tackling the challenge is 6ft 8in rugby boy Keith Larrard. Keith's hunky frame may come in handy on the rugby pitch, but in the kitchen it's another story.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Day four of the competition in Swansea sees Karen Wood playing host and she can't wait to get her guests partying in her hot tub, however the diners have mixed expectations of Karen's night.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the final night of the culinary competition in Swansea and poised to take the challenge is naughty solicitor Katherine Waldemar Brown. She's facing a tricky crowd, but luckily Katherine thinks she's got the skills to keep them in check.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Kay and Barry have decided it's time to fulfil their dream of buying a holiday home in the historic city of Jerez in Spain. Can Jasmine Harman find their perfect place for their £105k?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Katrin and Thomas want a holiday home with a pool, mountain views and some land in the spectacular countryside of Málaga. Danni Menzies tries to find their dream place with a budget of £250,000.

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: Without proper recipes to hand, a brand-new batch of pastry chefs must create 36 individual opéra aux fruit and one chocolate amenity. In the second challenge, the teams transform the classic banoffee pie into an incredible fine-dining experience.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: Journalist Eddie Brock is trying to take down Carlton Drake, the notorious and brilliant founder of the Life Foundation. While investigating one of Drake's experiments, Eddie's body merges with the alien Venom -- leaving him with superhuman strength and power. Twisted, dark and fueled by rage, Venom tries to control the new and dangerous abilities that Eddie finds so intoxicating.

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: Emilia Fox and criminologist David Wilson narrow the suspects down to one man in the previously unsolved case of estate agent Suzy Lamplugh, who went missing in 1986 in Fulham, London.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet

programme.desc: After numerous eyewitness accounts of the Tasmanian tiger in Australia, Forrest heads to the Cape York Peninsula in search of this unique species along with researchers from the James Cook University.

programme.title: Amanda to the Rescue
programme.desc: After the devastation caused by Hurricane Maria, many pets were separated from their owners. Amanda goes to Puerto Rico to rescue as many dogs as she can.

programme.title: Guardians of Rescue
programme.desc: Group founder Rob and investigators Marceline, Bill and Elle try to unmask a puppy flipper. Plus, Brian and Face look for a dog in a mechanic's hoard.

programme.title: Guardians of Rescue
programme.desc: Rob and vet Moose investigate a claim about dogfighting, while Brian and Face try to help an aggressive dog on a chain. Plus, Dori helps a homeless vet, and his cats.

programme.title: America's Cutest Pets
programme.desc: Meet some cute felines who are so wacky they seem dazed. Plus, witness cats around humans they barely tolerate.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff treats a couple's cherished bloodhound puppy that will not eat. Dr Petra races to save a cat after it swallows a handful of hair ties and Dr Jeff and Hector head out to a veteran's ranch to help a baby therapy yak.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest Galante arrives in his home town, Zimbabwe, to look for the mysterious Cape lion along with his crew. However, his task is not easy, as there is some cruel wildlife waiting for him in the jungle.

programme.title: Amanda to the Rescue
programme.desc: Amanda goes undercover to take in three dogs rescued from puppy mills, including a sweet chihuahua that steals the heart of one of her crew members.

programme.title: Crikey! It's the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert handles an aggressive wombat called Bunker, and it's moving day for a giant anaconda called Nikki; Terri helps treat hundreds of lorikeets injured by a hailstorm; Later, Robert and Chandler team up to bake a special treat for the Irwin ladies.

programme.title: Crikey! It's the Irwins
programme.desc: Terri responds to the call when Daniel, a very special wallaby, becomes severely injured and cannot walk; Robert and Chandler catch some waves before taking a road trip to pick up a new Komodo dragon; Bindi checks in on Tallbert the giraffe calf.

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Otto and Charlotte defend against the homestead's first predator attacks. Meanwhile, Atz Lee and Jane travel to Lake Louise to catch massive lake trout.

programme.title: Swimming With Monsters With Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve attempts to swim with Africa's most dangerous animal, the Hippopotamus. He attempts to get close enough to this unpredictable animal to study their secret underwater behaviour.

programme.title: Rugged Justice
programme.desc: Officers confront bear poachers as an inebriated suspect is taken to jail. Plus, a man with an outstanding warrant is caught having sexual relations with a woman.

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: The surprising story of the hidden powerhouse behind the globalised world - the diesel engine, a 19th-century invention that has become indispensable to the 21st. It's a turtle versus hare tale in which the diesel engine races the petrol engine in a competition to replace ageing steam technology - a race eventually won hands down by diesel. Car enthusiast presenter Mark Evans gets excitedly hands on with some of the many applications of Mr Diesel's original creation.

programme.title: The NHS: A People's History
programme.desc: Alex Brooker continues to chart the history of the National Health Service via the treasured memories of patients and staff whose lives it has affected since its inception in 1948. This episode covers 1997 to the present day and unveils a whole host of unique, highly-personal artefacts.

programme.title: Escape to Athena
programme.desc: A group of Allied prisoners of war plan to escape while excavating an archaeological site on a German-occupied Greek island, but the motley crew cannot resist the idea of taking some Greek art treasures with them.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Richard Skinner present performances by Dead Or Alive, Tears for Fears, The Damned, Fine Young Cannibals and Sister Sledge. Also clips from Simply Red, The Cult, The Style Council and Opus.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Gary Davies presents performances by Shakin' Stevens, A-ha!, Black, The Christians, Pet Shop Boys and Terence Trent D'Arby. Also clips from Genesis, Jackie Wilson, Mel & Kim and Heart.

programme.title: Radio 2 In Concert: a-ha
programme.desc: From the BBC Radio Theatre, multi-platinum selling Norwegian band a-ha perform hits old and new for a BBC Radio 2 In Concert show presented by Jo Whiley.

programme.title: Radio 2 In Concert
programme.desc: Jo Whiley welcomes an intimate audience to the BBC Radio Theatre as synth pop greats Tears for Fears celebrate their reunion following a sold-out summer arena tour, highlighted by their triumphant UK return in front of 65,000-plus fans as special guests of The Killers during British Summer Time Festival at Hyde Park.

programme.title: The BBC One Sessions
programme.desc: Pop's enduring diva is on scintillating form in an intimate concert from LSO St Luke's in London. Annie Lennox storms through a set packed with hits from her solo career and back to the Eurythmics days.

programme.title: 6 Music Festival
programme.desc: With the release of their new album `Spirit', Depeche Mode return to the stage for BBC Radio 6 Music Festival, before they embark on a world tour. Depeche Mode, who formed in 1980 in Basildon, Essex, have not played at the 2,000-capacity Barrowland Ballroom in Glasgow for more than 30 years, when they performed as part of their Some Great Reward tour. Now, back at the historic Barrowland, their amazing return as part of 6 Music Festival is captured.

programme.title: The Old Grey Whistle Test
programme.desc: Annie Nightingale introduces Toyah, live in concert on Christmas Eve 1981 at the Theatre Royal Drury Lane.

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Explorer Paul Rose tells the story of the USS Squalus submarine which became stranded on the bottom of the Atlantic in 1937.

programme.title: Beck
programme.desc: A man is found dead at a flea market in southern Stockholm. It looks like an ordinary robbery gone wrong, but the investigation takes an unexpected turn when the secret police (Säpo) take an interest in the case.

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Comic game show hosted by the outrageous Lily Savage, as portrayed by Paul O'Grady. Helping tonight's contestants, as they compete for an array of unlikely prizes, are celebrity panellists Barbara Windsor, Ant McPartlin, Roy Barraclough, Roger Black, Jane Danson and Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Parkinson: the Interviews
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson looks back at some of his favourite interviews. This programme is an affectionate tribute to Peter Cook, featuring the highlights of Parkinson's many interviews with the comic genius.

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: Hancock decides to invest in a new camera - which Sid sees as the perfect opportunity to make some money.

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Terry is disappointed that Bob has asked someone else to be his best man, but he eventually agrees to go out for a meal with his friend. After a few drinks at the restaurant, they start to chat up a couple of pretty women who are also eating there.

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Capital: Secrets of Orkney
programme.desc: Chris Packham uncovers the secrets revealed by the DNA of Orkney's unique vole, and Neil Oliver explores Orkney's tombs and monuments. Meanwhile, Dr Shini Somara experiments to discover how the Orcadians could have moved giant blocks of stone over rough ground. Also, Andy Torbet climbs Orkney's most challenging sea-stack to unlock the story of Orkney's unusual geology.

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Explorer Paul Rose tells the story of the USS Squalus submarine which became stranded on the bottom of the Atlantic in 1937.

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Robert Winston narrates the shocking story of health in Britain before the National Health Service. In the early 20th century, getting treated if you were ill was a rudimentary, risky and costly business - a luxury few could afford. Using rare archive footage and personal testimony, the programme tells how ordinary people, GPs, midwives and local councils coped with a chaotic and ramshackle system.

programme.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream from Shakespeare's Globe
programme.desc: Shakespeare's riotous tale of love and magic, filmed live at the Globe Theatre in 2016. Emma Rice's exuberant production fuses music, dance and rich comedy.

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Capital: Secrets of Orkney
programme.desc: Andy Torbet and some local seafaring volunteers build a boat made of just willow and cow hide and set out to cross the dangerous Pentland Firth as the ancient Orcadians would have done. Neil Oliver investigates the extraordinary discovery of some human bones, Chris Packham goes in search of whales and Shini Somara uncovers the powers of the tides.

programme.title: Vienna: Empire, Dynasty and Dream
programme.desc: Simon Sebag Montefiore tells the story of Vienna triumphant, after the Ottoman threat receded at the end of the 17th century. The city was rebuilt. No longer an outpost defending the West from Islamic invaders, the Habsburgs vowed their empire and imperial capital would become the most glittering in the world. The Habsburg emperors transformed the city from a fortress into a great cultural capital.

programme.title: Mark Gatiss on John Minton: The Lost Man of British Art
programme.desc: John Minton was for a time one of the most popular 20th-century British artists, more famous than his contemporaries Francis Bacon and Lucian Freud. He has also been something of an obsession for actor and writer Mark Gatiss since he first saw one of his paintings as a teenager at the National Portrait Gallery. Mark Gatiss plunges back into Minton's world to celebrate his remarkable life and work, but also to find out why he remains all but forgotten.

programme.title: Inside Museums
programme.desc: Join art critic Alastair Sooke on a journey of discovery to the world's most inspiring museums. This time he is in Turkey's biggest city Istanbul as he explores the recently built new home of Istanbul Modern. He finds out what makes the art born at this unique meeting point of cultures so special and learns about Turkish culture as seen through the eyes of the country's most acclaimed modern artists.

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: Artist Tracey Emin speaks about undergoing treatment for cancer, her two abortions and the profound impact that both of these experiences have had on her artistic output. She also discusses the extraordinary effect that a painting by Mark Rothko had on her as a young woman, her affinity with the work of Edvard Munch and her friendship with David Bowie.

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers recently discovered that the mother of the wolf pack, Eliska, is pregnant. However, in today's episode, their joy turns to fear. They've spotted some very strange behaviour. Eliska is lethargic and not interested in her food.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Properties in Sittingbourne in Kent, Ferryhill in County Durham and Poplar in London that have been bought at property auctions are renovated by developers hoping to make a profit, either by renting out or selling on.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion travels to Leominster, where she finds out why the traditional Windsor chair has stood the test of time. programme.title: Live: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live and uninterrupted coverage from the world-famous grass courts of the All England Club, where Wimbledon 2023 is taking place. At this stage in 2022, world number one Iga Swiatek survived a minor scare when she dropped a set in her win over Lesley Pattinama Kerkhove of the Netherlands, while talented American Coco Gauff cruised into the third round with a straight-sets victory over Romanian Mihaela Buzarnescu on Centre Court.

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian and actor Emily Atack knows she is from a long line of larger-than-life entertainers. Her mum is singer, actor and comedian Kate Robbins and Paul McCartney is Emily's grandmother's cousin, making him Emily's first cousin twice removed. Recalling fun days out with the McCartney family when she was little and how Grandad Mike turned every opportunity into a comedy show, Emily sets out to find out more about her showbiz genes.

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: There was shock last year when a surprise family turned up at the park and established a home. Beavers started building a lodge on Half-Mile Lake alongside two hippos, half a dozen sea lions and a couple of big boats.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A mid-terrace in Stoke and a mid-terrace in Chatham get two very different makeovers. While in Pembroke Dock a two-bed basement flat with a serious damp problem is brought back up to scratch. Martin and Dion follow the progress of these auction buys as the developers try to turn a profit on their investments.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley presents today's show from Hemswell in Lincolnshire, with the reds and the blues led by Izzie Balmer and Mark Stacey. Both teams are keen to make a profit at auction. Meanwhile, Caroline hits the road to learn about the small bubble cars that were once very popular on British roads.

programme.desc: The big names behind the big stories. Laura Kuenssberg talks to those making the news, inside and outside politics.

programme.title: Politics London
programme.desc: The latest political news, interviews and debate.

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: A thought-provoking debate and instant audience reaction on the big ethical talking points of the week, together with roving reports from around the UK.

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Katherine Jenkins joins celebrations at the Roman Catholic cathedral in Arundel, West Sussex, marking the Feast of Corpus Christi. The festivities include a spectacular carpet of flowers and a procession from the cathedral to the castle.

programme.title: BBC Weekend News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: Detailed weather forecast.

programme.title: Live: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live tennis from Wimbledon continues with fourth-round matches on the manicured lawns of the All England Club in SW19. At this stage in 2022, Tunisia's Ons Jabeur continued her march towards history as she beat Belgium's Elise Mertens. Jabeur went on to become the first Arab to reach a Grand Slam singles final. Introduced by Isa Guha and Clare Balding.

programme.title: BBC Weekend News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Live: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: More live action comes from Wimbledon as coverage of the world-famous championships continues with the best matches from the fourth round.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Charlotte Smith are in Spalding, south Lincolnshire, the historic hub of Britain's bulb and flower farming industry, to explore its rich heritage, learn about the economic changes growers have faced, and discover how a new generation of farmers is shaping the future of the UK's flower industry. Charlotte meets James Lacey at his family farm to see how a UK favourite, the sunflower, is produced, picked and packed.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The roadshow is at Newby Hall in Yorkshire, where the finds include an intriguing letter from Lord Nelson, politely replying to his optician just weeks before the Battle of Trafalgar. There is also an engagement ring that was picked up in a pawn shop and a piece of the set from Live Aid, rescued from a skip. Familiar to those of a certain generation, it was used as the backdrop for a host of interviews with the world's greatest pop stars, from Bob Geldof to Bono and Brian May.

programme.title: BBC Weekend News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: BBC London
programme.desc: News, sport and weather from London.

programme.title: Rain Man
programme.desc: A self-centred young man discovers that he has been disinherited in favour of his autistic older brother, Raymond, who he never knew existed. Incredulous that a man who has no concept of the value of money has been left $3 million, he kidnaps Raymond and heads back to California from Cincinnati. However, Raymond's refusal to fly forces them to drive, and a touching relationship develops along the way.

programme.title: The Trials That Shocked Scotland
programme.desc: Following the disappearance of an Edinburgh woman, David Gilroy stood trial for her murder in 2012 at the High Court in Edinburgh. Five years later, married couple Edwin and Lorraine McLaren were in the dock accused of numerous property frauds. This complex trial would become the longest criminal court case in UK legal history.

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Nick and Dougie cook a braised Asian daube of beef with wasabi mash and black bean pak choi. Their special guest is impressionist Rory Bremner, who joins them in the kitchen for a chat and to try this week's food and drink combination.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: It's viewer question time this week at Beechgrove Garden as Carole Baxter and head gardener Scott Smith tackle some of the topical queries they have received. Carole is also back in the garden for wildlife, planting species that suit sunny conditions and that also give nature a helping hand.

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Banjo has been commissioned by fish shop manager and friend Sally, who wants to modernise her family's traditional business in Tobermory. Banjo has bold plans to utterly transform both the inside and outside of the shop, but Sally is worried that her family will disapprove of the radical makeover. With his band of trusty locals, including Eoghann the carpenter and handyman Tom, Banjo takes huge risks in realising his design ambitions.

programme.title: Nathan Evans: What the Wellerman Did Next
programme.desc: Nathan Evans never expected to become a global sensation when he posted a video of himself singing a sea shanty on TikTok.

programme.title: The Comedy Underground
programme.desc: Gemma Flynn says she's ok, Gareth Mutch is possessed, Wendy Wason struggles with the responsibilities of her generation, Raheil Ahmad just wants the right coffee, Scottish social media superstar Joe Heenan can't quite order the cake he wants and host Ray Bradshaw presents a glimpse into his life with deaf parents.

programme.title: Short Stuff
programme.desc: Quick, fresh and funny stuff from Scotland's best new comic voices. Featuring funny work from Stephen Buchanan, Stuart Hay, Stuart Elliott, Nathan Byrne and Elizabeth Caproni.

programme.title: Him & Her
programme.desc: Paul's son, Little Luke, is out of hospital so he's having a fancy dress party to celebrate. Steve and Becky have to go, but they don't want to. Becky dithers over a spot on her chin. Steve can't get through to his bank. When a furious Paul comes over to see why they're so late and what's happened to the sausage rolls, it seems they have no option but to go.

programme.title: Him & Her
programme.desc: Everyone is trying to watch the match between two local teams. Except Steve, who is bothered by a dream he had about Becky and her ex; Laura, who is bored; and Paul, who is miserable after his mum's shocking news. The afternoon couldn't really be going worse until Steve comes out with what appears to be a racist comment.

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?
programme.desc: Within hours of Annie Borjesson's body being found on a Scottish beach, her family are told it is suicide. However, they believe the evidence points to murder.

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?
programme.desc: Hazel pieces together the mysterious final hours before Annie was found dead. She hears an extraordinary theory that Annie's death was a state-sponsored hit job.

programme.title: The Fast and the Farmer-ish

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?

programme.title: Body on the Beach: What Happened to Annie?

programme.title: Angels of the North

programme.title: Angels of the North
programme.desc: It's the hottest day of the year, and Sammyjo wants to throw a housewarming party to remember. Everyone's in the party spirit, although Sammyjo just wants to keep her new house clean and tidy. At Longlox, Kendal is determined to stop smoking, and she has a novel way to kick the habit. At Pure Ink, Jade and Emma want to find the perfect outfits for Shane and John's upcoming bike ride.

programme.title: Angels of the North
programme.desc: Angels of the North join the Pride march. At Pure Ink, Jade is summoning up the courage to pierce her first nose, and Shane and John's health kick continues with a bike ride from the Angel of the North back to Pure Ink, but there's an unexpected bump in the road for John.

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in Cumbria, enjoying one of the most spectacular coastal railway journeys in Britain. In Ulverston, he sets sail in a small craft with a lifelong devotee of Arthur Ransome's `Swallows and Amazons'. At Barrow-in-Furness, Michael investigates the mountains of scrap left behind as iron ore was turned into ships, trains and railway tracks. From Silecroft, Michael hikes up Black Combe to join a champion endurance athlete as she navigates and runs across the fells.

programme.title: Frontline
programme.desc: In September 2022, a 22-year-old Iranian girl, Mahsa Amini, died in police custody. She had been arrested by Iran's religious police, accused of not wearing her hijab properly. The authorities said she had died of a heart attack, but rumours spread that she had been beaten on arrest. Citizens took to the streets in their thousands in fury.

programme.title: The Trouble with KanYe
programme.desc: In October 2022, Ye, formerly known as Kanye West, drew widespread condemnation after wearing a White Lives Matter T-shirt at his Paris Fashion Show. That controversy was swiftly followed up with a series of antisemitic statements on social media. Journalist Mobeen Azhar travel to the United States to try and discover how one of America's most celebrated artists became a megaphone for hate and division.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee masters his ambition of building a model of the Clubhouse out of sticks, so the Squirrels start to think about what their ambitions might be. Norrie wants to learn how to break dance. Happy has always wanted to jump the famous triple puddle splash. Betty has always wanted to teach Mr Cuddles how to speak Portuguese. Roly has loads, from growing a potato to becoming a pirate. Tag spends a long time thinking what his could be, and then it clicks - he needs to climb over the log!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are out walking around in the rain with Duggee and notice a rainbow. But before they know it, it's gone and the Squirrels are devastated. They decide to make their own rainbow and go off in search of all the colours from everything around them, including strawberries, carrots and bananas. Duggee shows the Squirrels what he has been working on too, a rainbow cake.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea traps Supertato and demands he tell her the secret of his superstrength. Supertato escapes and tells Evil Pea that his friends give him his strength.

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun and the flock take the opportunity to treat themselves to some home baked Pizza. When word gets out that the best Pizza is to be had from the `Mossy Bottom Takeaway', Shaun and the flock have to take production to the next level.

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Walter's pampered cat Clawdia persuades her way into the gang, and only Gnasher can tell that she has a hidden agenda to oust him from Dennis's life forever.

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Boy gets his dream job at the collectibles store. However, when a family of screeching birds makes the store entrance their home, the customers stay away.

programme.title: The Deep

programme.title: Game on Grandparents

programme.title: One Zoo Three

programme.title: Newsround

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve and his trusty team head to the frozen north of Norway. He follows the tracks of Europe's largest cat, the elusive lynx, up into the hills in the hope of seeing one, and gets a little nervous when he meets some in captivity. Arctic foxes and musk oxen are also on the menu in this deadly snowy episode.

programme.title: Pooch Perfect
programme.desc: In the semi-final, the last four competitors face a breed which judge Colin Taylor is world famous for grooming, the lamb-like Bedlington terrier. The groomers must also identify the parent breeds of a number of crossbreeds, and a dramatic transformation takes place on the dogwalk when the dogs take the shape of completely different animals, to the delight of their owners.

programme.desc: CNN's chief Washington correspondent, Jake Tapper, hosts this hour-long weekday afternoon program, which covers all the day's top stories from around the country and the world, headlines that span politics, money, sports and popular culture. "The Lead" works to ensure that viewers are caught up on the stories that matter, often highlighting news that may have been overlooked. Prior to joining CNN, Tapper served as senior White House correspondent at ABC News.

programme.title: The Situation Room With Wolf Blitzer

programme.title: Erin Burnett OutFront
programme.desc: It's Erin Burnett's turn to step out front and try to maintain a viable viewer presence for CNN in the weekday news arena. But the former CNBC anchor won't worry about ratings for her hourlong general news program, comparing that burden to "death." Instead, she'll concern herself with translating world events into relevant information for viewers, paying close attention to such topics as the Middle East and women's issues. "I want people to say that our show is smart. I want our show to be authentic", Burnett says in a promo. "I want our show to have courage". Left unsaid, of course, is that she wants her show to have a big audience, too.

programme.desc: CNN's chief Washington correspondent, Jake Tapper, hosts this hour-long weekday afternoon program, which covers all the day's top stories from around the country and the world, headlines that span politics, money, sports and popular culture. "The Lead" works to ensure that viewers are caught up on the stories that matter, often highlighting news that may have been overlooked. Prior to joining CNN, Tapper served as senior White House correspondent at ABC News.

programme.title: Smerconish
programme.desc: After serving as an MSNBC contributor and guest-host on the network for four years, TV and radio personality Michael Smerconish believed he was ready to head a show of his own. CNN agreed, and thus was born "Smerconish', an hourlong Saturday morning program that takes after its host's independent views. Using a topical, conversational format, he aims for the TV show to be an extension of his weekday radio broadcast, with free-flowing topics and the ability to discuss issues that strike a chord with the audience. Along the same lines, he thinks it's important to present the content in an engaging manner, free of my-way-or-the-highway ideology. Smerconish, who has a law degree from the University of Pennsylvania, is also a New York Times" best-selling author.

programme.title: Fareed Zakaria GPS
programme.desc: Host, columnist, and best-selling author Fareed Zakaria offers insightful analysis and interviews world leaders, artists, scientists, business leaders, global affairs analysts, and other cultural observers for the "Global Public Square'. Zakaria is also a syndicated columnist for The Washington Post, a contributing editor for The Atlantic magazine, and hosts in-depth, prime-time specials for CNN Worldwide. `Fareed Zakaria GPS' was launched in 2008 and each week's program airs worldwide on CNN, from New York or other locations around the world. The program is characterized by smart debate and discussion on world events and public affairs, designed to help viewers understand the world around them and the newest thinking on the globe"s biggest challenges.

programme.title: Inside Politics
programme.desc: With veteran Washington correspondent John King in the anchor chair, `Inside Politics' focuses on the top political stories of the day with a rotating round table of top sourced reporters from CNN and from other media outlets. The half-hour program gives viewers an inside look at the stories driving Washington, directly from reporters on the ground. Prior to its revival in 2014, `Inside Politics' was first headed by Judy Woodruff, and it aired for more than 20 years on CNN before its cancellation in 2005.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: An incredible look at plants and their ingenious solutions to life's challenges. Time-lapse photography reveals plants acting like fly-paper, or spring-loaded traps, to catch insects, while vines are shown developing suckers and claws to haul themselves up trees. Later the importance of shape for survival is illustrated by the dragon's blood tree, which captures mist and shades its roots through its unusual form.

programme.title: Costa Rica: The Rise of Nature
programme.desc: Costa Rica has the Pacific Coast to the East and the Caribbean to the west. Its incredibly rich marine ecosystems include 19 species of coral, mangrove forests and one of only four tropical fjord-like estuaries in the world.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: The zookeepers investigate when the Asian elephant herd at Dublin Zoo are woken from their sleep by a mysterious intruder. Ciarán and Aisleen travel to the coastal rainforests of Borneo, Indonesia to visit an orangutan conservation project.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Helen comes face to face with a troop of Western lowland gorillas in the wild rainforests of the Republic of the Congo. Ken and John have looked after Jubari, the rhino, since he was a young calf. Now old enough now to start a herd of his own, the time has come for the zoo keepers to say goodbye to one of their favourites.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: An amazing look at primates and their survival skills, from complex societies to tool use. Huge armies of Hamadryas baboons are seen battling on the plains of Ethiopia in order to steal females and settle old scores, Japanese macaques beat the cold by lounging in thermal springs - but only if they come from the right family, and an orang-utan baby fails in its struggle to make an umbrella out of leaves to keep off the rain.

programme.title: The Life of Birds by David Attenborough
programme.desc: Computer graphics recreate the period 150 million years ago when small, fast-running dinosaurs evolved feathers and took to the air. In New Zealand, David examines the environment required by birds which have survived without recourse to flight, and enjoys a midnight encounter with a kiwi, captured on a starlight-sensitive camera.

programme.title: The Hidden River
programme.desc: For the team, the final leg of the journey along the Essequibo River proves to be the most challenging. They face unpredictable weather and an outbreak of fever that threatens to put an end to their expedition.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Nato's Airborne Warning and Control System, a cutting-edge aircraft that enables pilots to spot hostile intrusion as they protect state borders of the countries in the alliance.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How in devising the F35 Lightning II, engineers have pushed the boundaries of aviation technology further than ever before and created a revolutionary, fighter aircraft.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A western lowland gorilla is accepted into the rest of the zoo's troop, leading to some exciting news. Tiger cubs and their mother explore the outdoor habitat for the first time.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Presenting the latest products live on television so that viewers can order the items they want directly. The product range extends from vacuum cleaners and bath towels to sports equipment.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team of explorers head to Greenland in the Arctic. Kayaking through the world's largest fjord during the spring thaw, they dodge giant icebergs and hungry polar bears.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve heads to Yucatan in Mexico as he searches for the secrets and artefacts of the Maya. Along the way, he descends into a subterranean system of caves that the Maya believed were a portal to the underworld.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve leads a team on a mission to become the first to successfully climb a remote mountain in the Stauning Alps of Greenland. In they process, they must cross a vast river and ski across a glacier.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve leads a team into the largest unexplored cave network on Earth. Below the jungles of Mexico, they traverse narrow passageways and flooded tunnels in a quest to go further than anyone has gone before.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve goes with a team of experienced kayakers to the Russian peninsula of Kamchatka. Here they hope to be the first ever to go on the wild water and discover an unspoiled wilderness where more brown bears live than anywhere else.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve joins cable expert Aldo Kane and Saudi geologists Mahmoud Al Shanti and Hala Alwagdani on a mission to explore a volcanic underworld beneath the ground of Saudi Arabia as they search for Arabia's longest lava tube.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: As the Nazis tore through Europe, they plundered numerous museums in search of holy relics that they believed would grant them untold power. Experts investigate these stories and whether Hitler really was close to discovering the Holy Grail.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Near Mount Ararat in Turkey is what scientists believe is a boat-shaped rock formation, but a research team hopes to prove it's the remains of Noah's Ark.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Mysterious crystal skulls could be long-lost relics of the Aztec and Maya civilisations that grant supernatural powers. Experts investigate new leads to reveal if these strange objects are genuine artefacts or simply modern-day fakes.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Ancient pyramids are among the greatest wonders of the world and exist across many civilisations, explore the origins of these structures as experts question if they were independently constructed or perhaps the design of something more mysterious.

programme.desc: It was believed that part of the Nazi party was involved and influenced in all manner of occult beliefs from their uniforms to their huge rallies.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond is making fairground food, starting with crazy Bacon Mac and Cheese Eggrolls. Then, there are Classic County Fair Turkey Legs served with a Sweet and Spicy BBQ Sauce, Cheese on a Stick and a cool, refreshing Raspberry Orange Italian Ice.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond lets the sunshine into her ranch kitchen with a stunning Coconut Shrimp Salad and very seasonal Summer Vegetable Enchiladas. Then, she crafts cute Corn Cakes with an incredible avocado salsa and finishes with cool Tropical Lime Parfaits.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond cooks up some delicious ideas for a barbecue feast using a Grilled Pineapple Pepper Relish to top both her Sticky BBQ Glazed Pork Tenderloin and Baked Cheese. She prepares Ree's Eat Your Greens Salad and a party-worthy Frozen Sangria.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond cooks up some quick and easy midweek dinners, starting with Grilled Steak Naan Tacos and fast Salmon Bites with Warm Brussels Sprout Slaw. She makes Shortcut Cheesy Sausage One Pot Gnocchi and speedy Crispy Everything Chicken Cutlets.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond and her sister Betsy bring a taste of Seattle to the prairie. They whip up a Clam Dip that's perfect with Betsy's Potato Chips, Crispy Savory Pancakes and a Baked Fontina Cheese Board, all washed down with a refreshing Strawberry Spritz.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond wins big with a spread of great game day favourites. She kicks off with Bacon Cheeseburger Dip, followed by a Salsa Trio that's in a different league. She tackles crowd-pleasing Popcorn Chicken with Maple Mustard Dip and a Bratwurst Bar.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond cooks some no-fail fall favourites, starting with an Autumn Steak Salad and a one-pan Fall Chicken Skillet. Then, she prepares Santa Fe Eggs in Purgatory for an all-day breakfast and her quick Mini Chocolate Tarts.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares fall sweets for visitors at her and her sister's remodeled home. She starts the housewarming with her classic S'mores Cookies, shortcut Cherry Cheesecake Brownie Cups, easy Apple Fritters and divine Pumpkin Pie Snacking Granola.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond thinks thrifty with meals that are budget-friendly and big on flavour. She makes hearty Veggie Ragu with Cheesy Polenta, a 16-minute Creamy Pork Chop Pasta, stunning Slow Cooker Chicken Verde Burritos and her mash-up Cheeseburger Bowls.

programme.title: James Martin's French Road Trip
programme.desc: James Martin and chef Daniel Galmiche visit the food markets in Reims. Later, they cook pan-fried lamb with smoked garlic and Provencal vegetables.

programme.title: James Martin's French Road Trip

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc
programme.desc: Raymond Blanc pays culinary homage to his Maman Blanc by sharing nostalgic dishes from his childhood, including vegetable soup three ways, and a special assiette of salads made with produce fresh from his gardens. Nathan Outlaw visits and treats Raymond to his childhood favourite, fish and chips with mushy peas and tartare sauce.

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc
programme.desc: Herbs and spices have the power to transform dishes to something truly brilliant. Raymond Blanc indulges the nation's senses by transforming classic dishes with herbs and spices fresh from his garden. From moules three ways, to a spicy slow-roasted harissa lamb shoulder with chickpeas, there's something for every palette. Joining Raymond in the kitchen is Niall Keating, who cooks poached plaice with kohlrabi.

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc
programme.desc: Raymond Blanc shares his love of travel and embracing the influence of other cultures into his cuisine. An enrichment of his own French culture and cuisine he cooks a sensationally fresh flash fired squid, with a fennel and rocket salad, and later a miso and harissa aubergine with cous cous. Plus, chef and good friend José Pizarro visits and indulges Raymond with an alfresco worthy dish, pan fried salted cod with chickpeas, white beans and spinach stew.

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc
programme.desc: Raymond shares his love of new produce from the gardens and explains why seasonality is important and why we should all embrace it. From his Oxfordshire kitchen he cooks pan-fried salmon, with spinach and chive butter sauce, to a walk in the woods, where he rustles up a fricassee of wild mushrooms. Long-time friend Jean-Christophe Novelli pays Raymond a visit and bakes him an indulgent tarte tatin, baked apple with caramel.

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc
programme.desc: Raymond Blanc shares his archive of recipes and introduces the nation to his favourite dishes which have featured on the menus across his restaurants. He shares the secret to a sensational Morteau sausage salad, to an elegant culinary centrepiece, gravadlax with cucumber, cauliflower and horseradish crème fraîche. Plus, Head Chef to Raymond's Brasseries, Clive Fretwell, joins him in the kitchen and cooks a double baked cheese souffle.

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc
programme.desc: Anniversaries, date nights and romantic get-togethers: Raymond shares his favourite romantic meals to treat the nation's couples. He starts with a special dish cooked for him by his partner, broad beans with parmesan and pan-fried sole, and ends with a sumptuous dessert: an exotic fruit pannacotta. Plus, chef and good friend Paul Ainsworth cooks a special dish for Raymond: his lamb hotpot for two.

programme.title: Building the Dream
programme.desc: Many people think building their dream home is out of their budget. But it doesn't have to be. As far as architectural designer Charlie Luxton is concerned, it doesn't have to break the bank, and he wants to prove it. As presenter of `Building the Dream', Luxton works with potential homeowners looking to turn a plot of land into their dream home that suits their lifestyles but doesn't cost too much to build. The first-time builders then must choose whether to take the advice under consideration in their designs or ignore it and stick to their original plans.

programme.desc: Gino starts his epic journey in France. From the Alpine town Breil-Sur-Roya he can travel into Italy in style on a train journey that takes him right through the Alps. In Italy, he meets a local doctor who does his rounds on horseback, through vineyards and hazelnut groves, where Gino prepares a scrumptious chocolate cheesecake. He travels on to the beautiful city of Turin, where he gets a personal tour - Italian Job style - in the seat of a classic Fiat 500.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Express
programme.desc: Gino's next rail journey takes him on a trip of a lifetime, through the wonderful Tuscan countryside on a historic steam train - Treno Natura. Setting off from Siena, this tourist train arrives in the town of Asciano where Gino rustles up a traditional local dessert called panforte. Gino's final stop is a vineyard in the Chianti region where locals practice the ancient tradition of vinotherapy.

programme.title: While You Were Sleeping

programme.desc: A patient with an ankle injury recalls how meeting her husband saved her life. Meanwhile, 84-year-old Ioannis is treated for dizziness as his kids speak warmly of a brave, loving father.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 11-year-old is brought in after being struck by a car. A woman has tripped over her cat. A doctor describes the painful decision to live away from home for the pandemic.

programme.desc: George tries to hang a heavy chandelier from an original ceiling in a Georgian townhouse in Yorkshire, before tackling a Georgian farmhouse in the Peak District that's a decorative nightmare, with hideous wallpaper and horrible carpet.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This week's competition is in and around Brighton, where first host, 47-year-old radio presenter Guy, hopes his musical and Mexican-themed menu and an air guitar competition will be a hit.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the second day in and around Brighton and bubbly 26-year-old Emma is hosting a beach-themed dinner party, but there's a last minute disaster when dessert lands in her lap.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's day three in Brighton and the turn of Dutch pilot Tim who tries to host his way to the prize. Tim is taking advantage of his worldly travels with a truly international and varied menu.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's day four in and around Brighton and personal trainer Hannah hopes to reveal a lot more about herself. There is no shortage of surprises as layer after saucy layer is peeled away.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the final night in and around Brighton, and time for 50-year-old Monti to try and cast his love spells over his guests in an attempt to win the £1000 cash prize.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Jacobs Plough in Bicester, Oxfordshire, run by manager Duncan Froomes and bar supervisor Ryan Hunt who like to mix banter with business. The criticism continues, with feedback that leaves the hosts praying for a miracle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Bonnie and Clyde
programme.desc: Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow were the most famous criminal couple in US history. During the height of the Great Depression, their gang evolved from petty thieves to nationally known bank robbers and murderers, joining the ranks of other gangsters of the era like John Dillinger, Pretty Boy Floyd and Baby Face Nelson.

programme.title: Her War, Her Story: World War II
programme.desc: From the U.S. Women's Army Corps to the civilian witnesses to the war in Europe, Jane Lynch narrates the stories of more than two dozen women's experiences in World War II.

programme.title: WWII in Colour: Road to Victory
programme.desc: In June 1944, a monumental battle between American and Japanese aircraft carriers in the Philippine Sea turns the tide in the Pacific.

programme.title: Stalin's Executioners: The Katyn Massacre
programme.desc: In 1940, the Soviet Union ordered the execution of 22,000 Polish prisoners of war, of whom 4,500 were murdered in the Katyn forest in Russia. A look at the Katyn massacre as seen from both sides: that of the victims and that of the perpetrators.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett explores how the Normans developed from a band of marauding Vikings into the formidable warriors who conquered England in 1066. He tells how the Normans established their new province of Normandy - `land of the northmen' - in northern France. They went on to build some of the finest churches in Europe and turned into an unstoppable force of Christian knights and warriors.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett explores the impact of the Norman Conquest of Britain and Ireland. Bartlett shows how William the Conqueror imposed a new aristocracy, savagely cut down opposition and built scores of castles and cathedrals to intimidate and control. He also commissioned the Domesday Book, the greatest national survey of England that had ever been attempted.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett explores the impact of the Normans on southern Europe and the Middle East. The Normans spread south in the 11th century, winning control of southern Italy and the island of Sicily. There they created their most prosperous kingdom, where Christianity and Islam co-existed in relative harmony and mutual tolerance, but events in the Middle East provoked the more aggressive side of the Norman character.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Dr Stephen Baxter reveals the human and political drama that lies within England's earliest surviving public record, the Domesday Book, which was commissioned by the Normans.

They went on to build some of the finest churches in Europe and turned into an unstoppable force of Christian knights and warriors.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett explores the impact of the Norman Conquest of Britain and Ireland. Bartlett shows how William the Conqueror imposed a new aristocracy, savagely cut down opposition and built scores of castles and cathedrals to intimidate and control. He also commissioned the Domesday Book, the greatest national survey of England that had ever been attempted.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett explores the impact of the Normans on southern Europe and the Middle East. The Normans spread south in the 11th century, winning control of southern Italy and the island of Sicily. There they created their most prosperous kingdom, where Christianity and Islam co-existed in relative harmony and mutual tolerance, but events in the Middle East provoked the more aggressive side of the Norman character.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Dr Stephen Baxter reveals the human and political drama that lies within England's earliest surviving public record, the Domesday Book, which was commissioned by the Normans.

programme.title: Flood in the Desert
programme.desc: The March 1928 St. Francis Dam collapse and its aftermath, which included a flood that claimed the lives of more than 400 people.

programme.title: Resident Evil: Vendetta
programme.desc: Soldiers battle hordes of zombies while trying to prevent a madman from unleashing a deadly virus in New York.

programme.desc: Frodo is a hobbit who elects to become the bearer of the Ring of Power, which, if reclaimed by its maker and master Lord Sauron, will see him gain full and terrible power over all of Middle Earth. Frodo sets out with The Fellowship of the Ring, led by Gandalf and Aragorn, and six other companions to Sauron's stronghold, Mordor, the only place where the ring can be destroyed.

programme.title: San Andreas
programme.desc: After a devastating earthquake hits California, a rescue-helicopter pilot and his ex-wife attempt to leave Los Angeles and head to San Francisco to find and rescue their estranged daughter.

programme.title: Godzilla
programme.desc: Effects-laden blockbuster about a huge reptile which emerges from the sea to wreak havoc in Manhattan. On a research trip to Chernobyl, a young scientist discovers a startling link between genetic mutation and radioactivity. When a fishing trawler is attacked by an unseen creature, and other evidence of a massive reptilian creature is unearthed, he realises that the creature is following a destructive path to New York.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Spectacular Sequels

Although their mission is compromised and an innocent is in danger, soldier of fortune Barney and his comrades decide to get the job done.

Then, to buy Frodo and Sam time, they must march to the very gates of Mordor to distract Sauron's gaze from the Ring bearer.

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: Betrayed by her evil sister Ravenna, heartbroken Freya retreats to a northern kingdom to raise an army of huntsmen as her protectors. Gifted with the ability to freeze her enemies in ice, Freya teaches her young soldiers to never fall in love. When Eric and fellow warrior Sara defy this rule, the angry queen does whatever she can to stop them. As war between the siblings escalates, Eric and Sara try to end Ravenna's wicked reign.

programme.title: King Arthur: Legend of the Sword
programme.desc: Robbed of his birthright, Arthur grows up the hard way in the back alleys of the city, not knowing who he truly is. When fate leads him to pull the Excalibur sword from stone, Arthur embraces his true destiny to become a legendary fighter and leader.

programme.title: John Wick
programme.desc: When sadistic mobster Iosef Tarasov and his thugs steal John Wick's prized car, and kill the puppy that was a last gift from his beloved late wife, John unleashes the remorseless killing machine within and seeks vengeance.

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 2
programme.desc: Retired super-assassin John Wick's plans to resume a quiet civilian life are cut short when Italian gangster Santino D'Antonio shows up on his doorstep with a gold marker, compelling him to repay past favours. Ordered by Winston, the kingpin of secret assassin society The Continental, to respect the organization's ancient code, Wick reluctantly accepts the assignment to travel to Rome to take out D'Antonio's sister, the ruthless capo atop the Italian Camorra crime syndicate.

In an attempt to rehabilitate himself, Joey assumes another man's identity and seeks the aid of Sister Cristina, a young nun who works at an inner-city parish.

programme.desc: The story of a reclusive green ogre called Shrek whose life of solitude is disrupted by a horde of refugees who have been banished by the evil Lord Farquaad. programme.title: Animals United
programme.desc: Fed up with the pollution caused by humans, animals seek a natural paradise away from them. However, upon their arrival, they discover a huge human-made dam that holds back the water and prevents it from flooding the valley's meadows.

programme.title: Shrek
programme.desc: The story of a reclusive green ogre called Shrek whose life of solitude is disrupted by a horde of refugees who have been banished by the evil Lord Farquaad. Determined to save his home, Shrek cuts a deal with the tyrant, who sets him a daunting task - if Shrek is ever to enjoy peace and quiet again, he must rescue Farquaad's bride-to-be from a dangerous castle. A Dreamworks animation.

programme.title: Shrek 2
programme.desc: Ogre Shrek and his new wife Fiona are surprised to discover a letter from her parents, inviting them over for dinner. Fiona is eager to show off her new husband, but her parents don't yet know she's an ogre. Taking Donkey along, they set off for Far Far Away to visit them, but the trip is hampered by the jealousy of a wicked fairy godmother and her hired assassin, Puss in Boots. A DreamWorks animation.

programme.title: Shrek the Third
programme.desc: Shrek is just starting to settle down in his beloved swamp with his wife Fiona, but their mucky bliss doesn't last for long as word arrives that the ogre's froggy father-in-law is about to croak. The very last thing Shrek wants is to become King, but with no other heir in sight, it looks like the grumpy green one is destined never to live quietly in the swamp again. A glimmer of hope appears in the form of heir Artie. A DreamWorks animation.

programme.title: The Reef 2: High Tide
programme.desc: A fighting fish is trained in the skills of sea power and must protect his finny friends from marauding sharks.

programme.title: DC Super Hero Girls: Intergalactic Games
programme.desc: It is time for the Intergalactic Games where young super heroes will come together to compete in different events. When Super Hero High and Korugar Academy gather for the Games, Lena Luthor launches her villainous plan.

programme.title: Norm of the North: Family Vacation
programme.desc: Norm searches for his missing crown while fixing his family relationships.

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite
programme.desc: Geeky high schooler Napoleon fancies quiet Deb but can't ask her to the prom. His brother Kip has an online relationship and dreams of being a cage fighter, while his uncle Rico is more interested in his mail-order time-travel machine. Napoleon's mission is to help his friend Pedro win the student presidency from the nasty Summer.

programme.title: Together Together
programme.desc: A young loner becomes a surrogate mother for a single, middle-aged man who wants a child. Their unexpected relationship soon challenges their perceptions of connection, boundaries and the particulars of love.

programme.title: Bean: The Ultimate Disaster Movie
programme.desc: Mr Bean has somehow managed to get a job as a security guard. His latest assignment finds him travelling to America as an art expert, looking after the famous `Whistler's Mother' painting as it is transported from Britain to a posh new Los Angeles museum. The catch is that Bean is no art expert and his trip was a ploy by his British employers to get rid of him. Unfortunately, no one has warned the Americans about Mr Bean.

programme.title: Me, Myself and Di
programme.desc: When Janet wins the trip of a lifetime, she's convinced by her best friend to pretend to be the opposite of who she actually is, in the hope of finding love.

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: Sara and Jonathan meet, by chance, while shopping for gloves in New York. At the end of the evening Jonathan is in love, but Sara leaves him by cab, saying that if they are meant to be together, fate will find a way. Years later, as both are ready to marry different partners, destiny does indeed seem to conspire to rekindle their love.

programme.title: The Brady Bunch Movie
programme.desc: An unscrupulous developer schemes to gain control of the valuable real estate owned by the clean-cut Brady family.

programme.title: Bad Neighbours
programme.desc: Parents go to war with a neighbouring fraternity president who refuses to tone down his house's raucous activities.

programme.title: Bad Neighbours 2
programme.desc: Mac and Kelly are horrified when a wild sorority moves in next door. With their house sale at stake, the couple joins forces with their old enemy to take down the new neighbours.

programme.title: Last Holiday
programme.desc: A shy shop assistant learns she has just weeks to live, so she cashes in her life savings and travels to Europe for a luxury holiday.

programme.title: The Fighting Temptations
programme.desc: A New York executive down on his luck finds out he's been left $150,000 by his aunt Sally. Returning to his hometown in Georgia, he discovers there's a catch - he has to create a gospel choir capable of winning the Gospel Explosion competition. Recruiting the town's one decent singer, he assembles a mish-mash of singers, including local convicts, and sets about getting them into shape.

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: After her release from prison, a former CEO battles old enemies while trying to build a brownie empire with her ex-assistant.

programme.title: Kinky Boots
programme.desc: A Northampton shoe factory is on the verge of closing down, unable to compete with cheap imports. The reluctant and desperate owner is inspired by an outrageous drag queen to switch production to saucy footwear for transvestites.

programme.title: Superbad
programme.desc: Two inseparable best friends navigate the last weeks of high school and are invited to a gigantic house party. Together with their nerdy friend, they spend a long day trying to score enough alcohol to supply the party and inebriate two girls in order to kick-start their sex lives before they go off to college. Their quest is complicated after one of them falls in with two inept cops who are determined to show him a good time.

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: A normally well-behaved teenager goes wild while his parents are out of town. In charge at his parents' smart house, the 17-year-old sees the chance to make a fast buck when the prostitute, on the run from a scary pimp, appears at his door. He takes her in, and, following his school's entrepreneurial teachings, lets her turn the house into a brothel.

programme.title: The Brady Bunch Movie
programme.desc: An unscrupulous developer schemes to gain control of the valuable real estate owned by the clean-cut Brady family.

programme.title: Dr. Bird's Advice for Sad Poets

programme.title: How to Please a Woman
programme.desc: Inspired by a birthday surprise from her friends, a 50-year-old woman has a business idea to launch an all-male house-cleaning service.

programme.title: Dirty Grandpa
programme.desc: Right before his wedding, an uptight guy is tricked into driving his grandfather, a perverted former army general, to Florida for spring break.

programme.title: Blades of Glory
programme.desc: Chazz Michael Michaels and Jimmy MacElroy are the two titans of skating. At the Winter Olympics, the fierce rivals find themselves forced to share the winner's podium when they both score gold. The shower of glory doesn't last for long, as the pair descend into fisticuffs and set the mascot on fire. Disgraced and stripped of their medals, they can get back on ice, but only if they dance with each other as a pair.

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: After her release from prison, a former CEO battles old enemies while trying to build a brownie empire with her ex-assistant.

programme.title: 50 First Dates
programme.desc: Playboy vet Henry sets his heart on romancing Lucy, but she has short-term memory loss and can't remember anything that happened the day before. So every morning, Henry has to woo her again. Her friends and family are very protective, and Henry must convince them that he's in it for love.

programme.desc: Set on a Greek island, a young woman who is about to be married suspects that any one of three men could be her father. She invites them all to her wedding without telling her mother.

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Diary
programme.desc: A neurotic thirty-something resolves to take control of her life once and for all. She drinks, smokes and eats too much, and, worst of all, she falls for the wrong kind of man - passing over Mr Right for Mr Right Now. From the novel by Helen Fielding.

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: The most famous actress in the world. A second hand bookshop owner in Notting Hill. After colliding in the street they begin a relationship which is soon fraught with complications as the tabloid press hound her. He must then summon all his charm, ingenuity and patience if there is to be a happy ending.

programme.title: Bewitched
programme.desc: A beautiful young witch named Isabel, determined to live her life without witchcraft, transports herself to Hollywood in search of romance. A handsome but bumbling actor named Jack convinces Isabel to co-star in a remake of the original `Bewitched' series in a move to resurrect his career. The two fall in love causing the worlds of witches and mortals to collide.

programme.title: Rough Night
programme.desc: An engaged politician reunites with three of her college friends for a wild bachelorette weekend in Miami. The night of hard partying soon takes a hilariously dark turn when a male stripper accidentally dies at their beach house.

programme.title: Beavis and Butt-head Do America
programme.desc: MTV's animated teenage numbskulls go on a cross-country quest to retrieve their stolen TV, but have to make lots of detours when someone puts a biological weapon down Beavis' shorts.

programme.desc: A single man who drinks too much. A father with three daughters who he rarely sees. A guy who is overweight and unemployed. A hen-pecked househusband. A successful Hollywood agent married to a fashion designer. What do these five men have in common? They used to play for the same basketball team at school. Now their former coach has died, and they are reunited at his funeral. Will the group rediscover old bonds?

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Bridget's brand new relationship with Darcy has taken a plummet due to her jealousy of his workmate. Having previously left the publishing house she worked for to avoid her boss, Daniel, with whom she had an unsuccessful romance, she finds him along for the ride on her new job, which takes her to Thailand, and almost into his arms.

programme.title: Shaun of the Dead
programme.desc: Shaun's humdrum existence takes a turn for the interesting when the undead take over London. Leaping into action, Shaun gathers his loved ones in the safest place he knows. Shaun, his mum and her boyfriend, his girlfriend, Liz, and his flatmates Ed and Pete fight off a fate worse than death from the local pub.

programme.title: Beavis and Butt-head Do America
programme.desc: MTV's animated teenage numbskulls go on a cross-country quest to retrieve their stolen TV, but have to make lots of detours when someone puts a biological weapon down Beavis' shorts.

programme.title: Me You Madness
programme.desc: A young thief cases an architectural dream house in Malibu, not realising it is the home of an eccentric female serial killer.

programme.title: Carry on Nurse
programme.desc: Set in Haven Hospital where a certain men's ward is causing more havoc than the whole hospital put together. The formidable Matron's debut gives the patients a chill every time she walks past, with only Reckitt standing up to her. There's a major who is a constant nuisance, a bumbling nurse, a romance between Ted York and Nurse Denton and Bell who wants his bunyon removed straight away.

programme.title: The Estate
programme.desc: Two sisters try to win over their terminally ill, difficult-to-please aunt in hopes of becoming the beneficiaries of her wealthy estate, only to find the rest of their greedy family has the same idea.

programme.title: The Stepford Wives
programme.desc: A former TV executive and her husband look for a fresh start in handsome Stepford, but there's something eerie about the town's perfectly groomed wives. Wife Joanna makes a few friends, but when they start to change, she becomes suspicious.

programme.title: 13 Going on 30
programme.desc: A girl who's sick of the social strictures of junior high is transformed into a grownup overnight. In this feel-good fairy tale, teenager Jenna wants a boyfriend, and when she's unable to find one, she fantasizes about being a well-adjusted adult. Suddenly, her secret desire becomes a reality, and she is transformed into a 30-year-old. However, adulthood, with its own set of male-female challenges, isn't as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Ticket to Paradise
programme.desc: A divorced couple teams up and travels to Bali to stop their daughter from making the same mistake they think they made 25 years ago.

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason

programme.title: Grown Ups 2
programme.desc: Lenny Feder moves his family back to his hometown to be with his old friends and finds out that he didn't leave the crazy life behind in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Baby
programme.desc: Befuddled mom-to-be Bridget Jones must figure out which of the two men in her life is the father of her child.

programme.title: Hot Fuzz
programme.desc: Hotshot police officer Nicholas Angel smells foul play when the residents of a sleepy Somerset village start to die in terrible `accidents'. Something's afoot, but can he and daft local plod Danny Butterman find out what?

programme.title: Ticket to Paradise
programme.desc: A divorced couple teams up and travels to Bali to stop their daughter from making the same mistake they think they made 25 years ago.

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: Aaron Falk goes back home to his drought-stricken town to attend a tragic funeral. However, his return reopens the door to the unsolved death of a teenage girl.

programme.title: The Electrical Life of Louis Wain
programme.desc: Louis Wain was many things during his incredible life: artist, inventor, entrepreneur and caretaker. After adopting a stray kitten, he went on to paint the extraordinary images of cats that made him world famous.

programme.title: Summering
programme.desc: Four best friends on the brink of starting middle school realize their lives are about to change forever. On the last weekend of summer, they set out to make the most of it.

programme.title: Sundown
programme.desc: A wealthy man is vacationing with loved ones at a resort in Acapulco, Mexico until he receives a phone call. There's been a death in the family, and everyone must return home. However, the man pretends to lose his passport, which delays his return.

programme.title: Dear Evan Hansen
programme.desc: A high school senior suffers from social anxiety disorder which leads him to struggle at school. His journey of self-discovery and acceptance begins following the suicide of a fellow classmate.

programme.title: Big Fish
programme.desc: Will always felt that his father ruined all the happy events of his childhood by telling tall tales. Now Edward is dying, so his estranged son comes home to make peace. As, yet again, Edward relates fanciful stories of his youth and his travels, Will starts to think that there could be some truth in them.

programme.title: Monster's Ball
programme.desc: Hank Grotowski is a prison guard whose son, who works on the prison's death row, commits suicide. Grotowski spirals into depression until one night he helps Leticia Musgrove's injured son. When he dies, the couple are united by grief, but as their relationship develops, he learns he and his son were party to the execution of her husband.

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: In 1988, a groundbreaking new group revolutionises music and pop culture, changing and influencing hip-hop forever. N.W.A's first studio album, "Straight Outta Compton," stirs controversy with its brutally honest depiction of life in Southern Los Angeles. With guidance from veteran manager Jerry Heller, band members Ice Cube, Dr Dre, Eazy-E, DJ Yella and MC Ren navigate their way through the industry, acquiring fame, fortune and a place in history.

programme.title: Staying Alive
programme.desc: Five years after leaving Brooklyn, Tony Manero is now working as a nightclub barman, while pursuing a burning ambition to become a Broadway sensation.

programme.title: Dreamgirls
programme.desc: After an ambitious manager gives them a shot at stardom, three singers learn that fame can carry a high personal cost.

programme.title: Call Me by Your Name
programme.desc: In Italy in 1983, a precocious 17-year-old and a young doctoral student discover the heady beauty of awakening desire over the course of a summer that will alter their lives forever.

programme.title: Dear Evan Hansen
programme.desc: A high school senior suffers from social anxiety disorder which leads him to struggle at school. His journey of self-discovery and acceptance begins following the suicide of a fellow classmate.

programme.title: A Second Chance
programme.desc: After serving 17 years in prison for a violent mistake he made in his youth, a once-aspiring baseball player returns to his Bronx neighbourhood.

programme.title: Cry Macho
programme.desc: A onetime rodeo star and washed-up horse breeder, in 1978, takes a job from an ex-boss to bring the man's young son home and away from his alcoholic mum. Crossing rural Mexico on their back way to Texas, the unlikely pair faces an unexpectedly challenging journey, during which the world-weary horseman may find his own sense of redemption through teaching the boy what it means to be a good man.

programme.title: Old Henry
programme.desc: A quiet man and his son take in a wounded stranger near his homestead, along with a bag full of cash. The stranger claims he's a sheriff being pursued by outlaws, but the man can't be sure.

programme.title: Six Minutes to Midnight
programme.desc: Summer 1939. Influential families in Nazi Germany have sent their daughters to a finishing school in an English seaside town to learn the language and be ambassadors for a future looking National Socialist. A teacher there sees what is coming and is trying to raise the alarm. But the authorities believe he is the problem.

programme.desc: Fate brings a teenage girl, a new student at school and a gun-toting neighbour together.

programme.desc: Prince Albert, who has suffered from a debilitating speech impediment all his life, is suddenly crowned king. With his country on the brink of war and in desperate need of a leader, his wife seeks out the help of an eccentric speech therapist.

programme.title: Twilight
programme.desc: When pretty teenager Bella Swan moves to small town Forks, Washington, it is not long before the boys notice her. On her first day of school, Bella's heart is lost to brooding loner Edward Cullen. He seems disinterested until, in a move that defies the laws of physics, he saves her from an accident in the car park. Now even more smitten, Bella pesters him with questions until he admits that he is a vampire.

programme.title: Ghost
programme.desc: A man is killed by a mugger and returns as his young girlfriend's ghostly guardian. Realising, in his spirit state, that his murder was premeditated and that her life is in great danger, he tries to make contact through a fake spiritualist.

programme.title: Stand by Me
programme.desc: Bittersweet film about a gang of four 12-year-old boys growing up in Oregon in the 1950s. The story is told in flashback years afterwards by one of the boys - now a writer - and revolves around their search through the countryside around their hometown for the body of a missing teenager, thought to have been killed by a train. Adapted from `The Body', a novella by Stephen King.

programme.title: Captain Fantastic
programme.desc: Raised in the forest and living off the grid, six children venture into the outside world for the first time when their recently widowed father takes them on a road trip.

programme.title: Dear Evan Hansen
programme.desc: A high school senior suffers from social anxiety disorder which leads him to struggle at school. His journey of self-discovery and acceptance begins following the suicide of a fellow classmate.

programme.title: Alice
programme.desc: Alice yearns for freedom as an enslaved woman under iron rule on a rural Georgia plantation. After a violent clash, she flees through the woods and stumbles onto the unfamiliar sight of a highway, soon discovering the year is actually 1973.

programme.title: Young Hearts
programme.desc: A 14-year-old develops a budding relationship with her brother's best friend while exploring unfair gender politics at their high school.

programme.title: Belfast
programme.desc: A nine-year-old boy experiences love, laughter, and loss as he comes of age amid the music and social tumult of the late 1960s.
